Scott Griggs

Atlanta, Georgia area · Contact Me

I've been lucky enough to have been able to pursue my dream of a career in aviation, but I have really missed working in IT. I have increased my skill set to include multiple AWS certifications in addition to my background in UNIX administration, and I am excited to rekindle my IT career.

Experience

Consultant

Daringway

Created a CI/CD environment for doing integration testing of multiple AWS terraform modules.

CI/CD pipeline leveraged Github Actions and terraform for the automation.

Implemented development workflow consistening of a PR review process with automated validation.

Created a multi Github repo workflow where changes in any module repo triggers integration test.

Integrated with Slack to post Github action status

July 2020 - Present

Airline Pilot

Atlantic Southeast Airlines / ExpressJet Airlines

Airline pilot responsible for the safety of the passengers, crew, cargo and aircraft during all phases of flight. I have flown the CRJ-200, CRJ-700, CRJ-900 and the Embraer E-175. I have more than 9,000 hours of flight time as an airline transport pilot.

October 2005 - Present

Flight Instructor / Ground Instructor

AirVentures Flight School

Taught ground school and gave flight instruction to student pilots.

June 2004 - October 2005

Senior UNIX Administrator

The Weather Channel

Coordinated the conversion of our SAN from EMC Symmetrix 5 to Hitachi 9960 hardware. Migrated all systems to the new hardware and setup development, test, and production Veritas clusters attached to the Hitachi via Brocade switches. Planned and coordinated the migration of all data from EMC to Hitachi.

UNIX system administrator for the interactive television development team and content group. They provided weather graphics for interactive television customers. My duties encompassed all their UNIX administration needs. This included development software loads and updates and all other day-to-day needs of the development team. The equipment supported consisted of were two Sun E450’s and four Sun E250’s.

Implemented our EMC storage solution into our data center. This required that I work closely with our EMC support engineers to integrate the equipment into our legacy system infrastructure and facilitate its use with our current and future projects. The system was a Symmetrix 5 with 1 TB of storage.

I provided day-to-day support for all Sun servers. This involved working with our solution center, development teams, and DBA group on a daily basis to provide 24/7 coverage and support.

April 2000 - November 2003

UNIX Consultant

The People Network

UNIX system administrator in the Production Services and Support group providing Tier II support for systems and applications and Tier III support for new projects. As Tier III, I was lead admin for the projects assigned to me which required coordination between the admin group, DBA group, the network group and the project manager to ensure the projects were successfully completed with the time frame assigned. As Tier II, I provided day-to-day UNIX support as required for applications and systems which included working tickets from Support Magic. The most common daily Tier II activities were NIS, DNS, backup, intranet issues and user administration. My major projects were Brio, Inconcert and notes migration to Sun.

UNIX system administrator for software development project. Provided general UNIX support in test, development and production environments for the development team. The equipment supported were two Sun E4000 and two Sun E6000 running Solaris 2.5.1 with multiple Oracle instances on each.

Setup hardware for an Oracle PDB cluster containing two Sun E6000 and four fully populated RSM storage arrays. Installed Solaris 2.5.1, all required software patches, the PDB software and configured it for use.

October 1997 - April 2000

UNIX Analyst

Paranet, Inc.

I worked multiple contracts for Sun Professional services installing Oracle Parallel Database clusters for clients which included Oracle, CNN and the State of Georgia.

October 1995 - October 1997

UNIX System Administrator

Delta Air Lines Inc. / TransQuest Information Solutions Inc.

UNIX administrator responsible for the corporate SMTP server. Managed the corporate firewall, NIS+, NFS and DNS servers. Monitored and maintained 100+ Sun workstations and servers.

February 1991 - October 1995

Projects

Cloud Resume Challenge

Project Link: cloudresumechallenge.dev

Built a resume website using AWS services. The site uses S3, DynamoDB, API Gateway, Lambda, Route 53, Certificate Manager, CloudFront and is version controlled with Git on GitHub. It uses HTTPS for security. The serverless function is written in Python and the backend is packaged with a SAM template and deployed via the AWS SAM CLI. I used GitHub Actions for the front end and back end to automate the CI/CD pipeline.

GitHub Repositorys github.com/ksgriggs/MyResume and github.com/ksgriggs/MyResum-SAM

July 2020
